definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The flowers and hanging baskets were breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 花朵和吊籃生機勃勃的長着。

sentences.english: it will be the time for China to demonstrate to the world the demeanor of its dramatic and dynamic new image.
sentences.chinese: 是中國展示它引人注目的和生機勃勃的新形象的時候。

sentences.english: A bright boy left his family, going to new York to seek his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 一個生機勃勃的少年離開家人，到紐約去闖世界。

sentences.english: I felt alive. I felt full of blood.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得生機勃勃，熱血沸騰。

sentences.english: Then I couldn't have imagined the dynamic and impressive city that Xi'an has turned into today.
sentences.chinese: 未曾想到，今天的西安如此生機勃勃，讓人印象深刻。

sentences.english: The oasis was alive, yet everything was still.
sentences.chinese: 綠洲生機勃勃，然而萬籟俱寂。

sentences.english: Through the short summer season, the valley is abuzz with activity.
sentences.chinese: 整個短暫的夏天裏，山谷裏鳥語花香，生機勃勃。

sentences.english: Diversity is alive and rampant—at least in my life.
sentences.chinese: 至少在我的生活裏，多元是生機勃勃且無所不在的。

sentences.english: Leadership is alive and well in this country.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家的領導力可謂生機勃勃。

sentences.english: Premier Wen said China-Pakistan friendship is deeply rooted, evergreen and vibrant.
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶說，中巴友誼根深葉茂，生機勃勃。

sentences.english: Human vibrant homes, Zhuanshun between appalling.
sentences.chinese: 人類生機勃勃的家園，轉瞬之間慘不忍睹。

sentences.english: China-Pakistan friendship is full of vigor and vitality, like a lush tree with deep roots and thick foliage.
sentences.chinese: 中巴友誼根深葉茂，生機勃勃。

sentences.english: I am feeling both alive and spaced out.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺我既生機勃勃又飄飄欲仙。

sentences.english: The flowers and hanging baskets were breathtaking .
sentences.chinese: 花朵和吊籃生機勃勃的長着。

sentences.english: Wendeng is a dynamic coastal open city.
sentences.chinese: 文登是一座生機勃勃的沿海開放城市。

definition: all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
(of an area) to have trees with shade-giving foliage/(of a road) to be tree-lined
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
